input: In 1980, more than 40 Class I rails operated across North America, and today there are only seven; by definition, a Class I rail generates at least $475 million of revenue. Consequently, on all but the busiest lanes, a single railroad often serves an end-of-the-line shipper, only two railroads operate in most regions, and the rails have been able to reinvest while becoming quite profitable.
